intro: Peucedanum pseudotaenidia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and other aromatic herbs. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. Peucedanum pseudotaenidia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides.
